Package com.uwgb.GBCoin.ProofOfWork

Class HashCash

java.lang.Object
com.uwgb.GBCoin.ProofOfWork.HashCash
public class HashCash extends Object
HashCash will be our Proof-of-Work concept which will offer a challenge to the miner to solve once the challenge is solved, the miner will propose the next block and transactions up for consensus This concept was created by Adam Back http://www.hashcash.org/

  • Constructor Details

    • HashCash

      public HashCash(int version, int difficulty, String resource, long timeStamp)
      Parameters:
      difficulty - [int] difficulty of the puzzle, each increase doubles the difficulty i.e 2^n
      version - [int] version of HashCash
      resource - [string] unique identifier, for Bitcoin it should be publicKey

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • mine

      public void mine()

    • isValidSolution

      public static boolean isValidSolution(String challenge, String nonce, int difficulty)
      Parameters:
      challenge - the full challenge string we want to solve
      nonce - the value that needs to be tested
      difficulty - [int] difficulty of the puzzle, each increase doubles the difficulty i.e 2^n
      Returns:
      true if the nonce value when encoded in base64 solves the puzzle

    • isSolutionToChallenge

      public static boolean isSolutionToChallenge(byte[] byteArray, int difficulty)
      Parameters:
      byteArray - [byte []] the byte array containing the bytes to check
      difficulty - [int] difficulty of the puzzle, each increase doubles the difficulty i.e 2^n
      Returns:
      returns true if a byte array has a certain number of leading zeros based on the difficulty

    • isBitSet

      public static boolean isBitSet(byte[] array, int bit)
      Method to return if a bit is set
      Parameters:
      array - [byte []] the byte array containing the bytes to check
      bit - [int] the bit we are trying to validite is set
      Returns:
      returns true if the bit is a 1 else false

    • getToken

      public String getToken() throws Exception
      Returns:
      the full token which is the challenge plus our nonce encoded
      Throws:
      Exception - We need to throw an exception for if the puzzle has not been solved therefore there is no full token
